title: Sound Opinions Show
teaser: Pink Floyd drummer Nick Mason has been the only constant member of the band throughout its entire history. He speaks with hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot about his half-century with the pioneering experimental rock band.  Later Jim and Greg review the surprise new mixtape from Drake.
description:
ANNOUNCER COPY: Coming up…Pink Floyd drummer Nick Mason talks about the band’s complicated history and highly anticipated reunion. Plus, rapper Drake surprised fans with a new album. But is it a Buy It, Try It or Trash It?    
NEWS:
• Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot discuss the effect television award shows and performances can have on sales. Industry insiders predict a big sales bump for Oscar winners Common and John Legend, similar to that experienced by Grammy winner Beck. Annie Lennox didn’t take home an award, but merely performing during the Grammy’s took her latest album to new heights. And after performing during the Superbowl Halftime show, Katy Perry’s singles and albums have also surged in sales.
• Hip-hop mogul Dr. Dre is celebrating his birthday in curious style…with an appearance on the cover of AARP magazine. 
FEATURE:
Amid decades of lineup changes, industry changes, personal squabbles and creative differences, Nick Mason is the lone, original member of Pink Floyd to have appeared on every recording. The drummer talks about the psychedelic band’s heyday, recent reunion and new album. He also remembers late keyboardist Rick Wright.
REVIEW:
Jim and Greg review If You’re Reading This It’s Too Late by rapper Drake. The surprise release broke streaming records and sold over 535,000 units in its first week, despite having no advance promotion.
DESERT ISLAND JUKEBOX:
Greg adds the 1991 track “What's the New Mary Jane” by Richard Davies’ first band The Moles to the Desert Island Jukebox.  The song takes its name from the Beatles’ famous outtake.
YOUR SOUND OPINIONS:
At the end of the show we hear comments from listeners.
